data.text: Bicycle Inner Tube Valve Stem Shifting and Bending

Has anyone had an issue with a valve stem shifting over time? My front tube stem slowly tilts over several weeks. If I leave it alone it will create a puncture at the base of the stem. I've had this happen with multiple tubes. It's not really a big deal to deflate and realign every few weeks but it's such a weird problem that I've never heard of or seen on any other bikes I've had.
Try swapping the front and back tubes. If the rear valve stem then creeps, it's the tube. If the front does, investigate the rim tape and tyre.

data.text: I wonder: #1 Are you running low pressure, low enough for your rim to be rolling on a folded tube? The different circumferences would stretch the separate layers & rotate at different speeds. #2 Are you running an undersized tube (smaller than the tire cavity) so that the tube must expand to fill the tire? The expanded tube would be thinner & harder than a properly fitted one & might let the tire slide around the rim too easily. If you mark the tire adjacent to the valve stem, do you catch the tire rotating around the rim over time?
